title: [Gyldemar Forest, Ruins]
description: Cyclopean marble and granite blocks lie scattered about, their surfaces rounded by ages of wind and rain.  Foundations of buildings circle a deep depression which may once have been a fountain or well, the mosaics set into the slabs all the more beautiful for the desolation that surrounds them.  Although they lean from the vertical, a few columns still stand near one of the largest and most ornate mosaics, marking the site as the probable center of town government or worship in the distant past.

Foundations of buildings circle a deep depression which may once have been a fountain or well, the mosaics set into the slabs all the more beautiful for the desolation that surrounds them.  Although they lean from the vertical, a few columns still stand near one of the largest and most ornate mosaics, marking the site as the probable center of town government or worship in the distant past.  The moonlight lends a ghostly glow to the ruins.
